title.narrative: 7.5 PLANNING, MONITORING AND EVALUATION

description.narrative: UNICEF uses optimal programme efficiency and effectiveness planning, monitoring and evaluation procedures and systems to achieve optimal results, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Evaluation And Research, Operations Support To Programme Delivery. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: UNICEF, the Government and partners adopt improved practices for effectively planning, implementing and monitoring programmes and delivering quality, multi-sectoral and equity focused resuls

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: UNICEF uses optimal programme efficiency and effectiveness planning, monitoring and evaluation procedures and systems to achieveoptimal results

description.narrative: In 2020, the Planning Monitoring & Evaluation (PM&E) team continued to scale up support to further centralize and monitor HACT-in-One processes, and coordinate resource mobilization stewardship and the partner wide improvements through HACT procedures through Partnerships competitive selection. Further, PME section provided strategic, technical, programmatic, and analytical support office-wide and to the front office. The team provided consistent support in view of Front Office decision making as well as continuous improvements in results reporting and monitoring. | Status:Met | As-of Date:11/01/2021
